<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
LEGAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/03/elizabeth-holmes-found-guilty-of-fraud-and-conspiracy-in-blockbuster-silicon-valley-trial?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
For Holmes, the Jig Is Up
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/03/elizabeth-holmes-found-guilty-of-fraud-and-conspiracy-in-blockbuster-silicon-valley-trial?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<img alt="Elizabeth Holmes speaks on stage during the closing session of the Clinton Global Initiative 2015 on September 29, 2015" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/2b8f302ccd5aba2b1ea3e1c6e2c3e2fc95242a02-1024x683.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>JP Yim/Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It took more than 50 hours of deliberations over seven days, but yesterday a jury found Theranos founder Elizabeth Holmes <a href="https://apnews.com/article/elizabeth-holmes-trial-theranos-ceo-fb79a29d3c426a5cadee7ec5734b6f24?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">guilty</a> on four charges of criminal fraud. Basically, they concluded that Holmes intentionally lied to investors to raise gobs of money for her company, a blood testing startup that promised to revolutionize health care.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Spoiler alert: It didn’t. And according to the jury, Holmes <em>knew</em> that it wouldn’t work out even as she touted the company’s tech capabilities to raise nearly $1 billion from the likes of Rupert Murdoch, the DeVos family, and the Waltons of Walmart fame.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The details: </strong>Holmes was convicted of three counts of wire fraud and one count of conspiracy to commit wire fraud. She was found not guilty on four other charges and the jury couldn’t agree on a verdict for the other three charges. So Holmes went 4/11.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How long will Holmes be behind bars? </strong>Each of those guilty counts could carry a sentence of 20 years in prison, but legal experts say she’ll probably serve less time than that, given typical sentences in white-collar fraud cases like hers.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">How we got here</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When she was 19, Holmes dropped out of Stanford to build a device that could perform hundreds of diagnostic tests more cheaply and more accurately than anything on the market. If the Brew were around back then, she probably would have been a regular—after all, she was labeled the youngest female self-made billionaire by Forbes and drew comparisons to Steve Jobs.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But things unraveled when WSJ investigations in 2015 and 2016 exposed Theranos’s vaunted technology for not actually working. Then came a slew of lawsuits and an indictment, and in 2018 the company dissolved in a thundercloud of disgrace.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>To many, Holmes’s story reflects the excesses of a venture capital industry that will plug any charismatic founder with a geyser of cash despite their ideas being untested. But Silicon Valley insiders <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2022-01-04/what-investors-learned-from-the-elizabeth-holmes-trial-zero?srnd=premium" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told Bloomberg</a> that, despite Holmes’s conviction, that faucet won’t be turned off anytime soon. The lure of exponential returns is that powerful.</p>
</div>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ANTITRUST
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/03/biden-goes-after-big-meat-to-combat-inflation?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
Biden Takes on Big Meat to Curb Inflation
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/03/biden-goes-after-big-meat-to-combat-inflation?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<img alt="Beef cow" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/48a42fff26ee041084deab836ec414b2837ebe61-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Your holiday brisket cost a lot more this year, and President Biden thinks market concentration in the meat industry is a big reason why.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The White House announced yesterday that it’s <a href="https://apnews.com/article/joe-biden-lifestyle-business-prices-inflation-78335dba9802d7eb727744301d4489df?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sending $1 billion</a> to independent meat and poultry producers in order to promote competition in the heavily concentrated industry. How concentrated?</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It said that four large meatpacking companies control 85% of the beef market. And this dominance allows these firms to drive up prices more than a market with many different players would allow.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Meat prices have increased quite a lot over the last year. While the consumer price index across all goods gained 6.8% annually in November, prices for meat rose 16%.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">It’s part of a bigger strategy</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While Biden is currently picking on meat producers, his administration has taken aim at several other industries where, the White House argues, a few big players have exacerbated inflation.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In November, for instance, he asked the FTC to </span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2021/11/17/biden-ftc-gas-prices/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">investigate</a></span><span> oil and gas companies for ”anti-consumer” behavior that’s driven up gas prices.</span>
</li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The counterargument: </strong>Industry groups and some economists say that blaming a lack of competition for recent inflation is like blaming apple juice for your hangover. After the White House alleged that profits for large meatpackers <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/us-policy/2022/01/03/white-house-beef-supply/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rose 300%</a> during the pandemic, the North American Meat Institute said this analysis “conveniently” omits factors sending prices higher such as worker shortages and supply chain bottlenecks. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Whether they curb inflation or not, crackdowns on anti-competitive behavior have become a <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/12/25/business/biden-inflation.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">central feature</a> of Biden’s economic strategy. Over the summer, even before price growth got out of hand, he issued an executive order with 72 directives to step up antitrust enforcement and promote competition.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

</a><span>  </span>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EDUCATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/covid-omicron-surge-delays-cancellations-schools?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
Back to School Fumbles Its Way Into the New Year
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you thought yesterday was a calm first day back at work, you probably don’t have kids. Public schools in Cleveland, Milwaukee, Atlanta, Newark, and some districts in Michigan have all delayed their starts or switched to remote learning until at least January 10 because of skyrocketing Covid cases among students and staff.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And for schools that stayed open, safety precautions across districts are about as standard as women’s jeans sizing.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Staff at LA County public and private schools will be required to wear </span><span><a href="https://www.latimes.com/california/story/2022-01-02/l-a-school-staff-to-use-high-grade-masks-amid-omicron-surge?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">medical grade masks</a></span><span> indoors and in crowded spaces outdoors.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>On the other hand, Johnson County—the most populous county in Kansas—is </span><span><a href="https://www.kansascity.com/news/coronavirus/article256941607.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">considering</a></span><span> ending its mask mandate for elementary schools as early as this Thursday.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Local leaders who’ve vowed to keep schools open are being met with increased resistance from teachers groups. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In New York City, where Mayor Eric Adams has <a href="https://apnews.com/article/coronavirus-pandemic-health-lifestyle-nyc-state-wire-new-york-city-27cf48a4e6bf27b65cad886f979c4127?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">insisted</a> that schools are the safest place for students, representatives of the teachers’ union aren’t so sure that simply sending 1.5 million rapid tests to schools is enough. And in Chicago, teachers have <a href="https://blockclubchicago.org/2022/01/03/chicago-teachers-may-refuse-to-work-in-schools-starting-wednesday-amid-covid-19-surge/?utm_source=Pico&utm_campaign=daa130ae48-EMAIL_CAMPAIGN_2021_12_06_01_52_COPY_01&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_b6b84a5cee-daa130ae48-127052550&mc_cid=daa130ae48&mc_eid=22c845c6a6" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">threatened</a> to stop working in-person on Wednesday after a botched at-home testing plan led to a backlog of unprocessed student tests.—<em>MM</em></p>
</div>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/03/key-performance-indicators-january-4?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>For a brief moment yesterday, Apple became the <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2022/01/03/technology/apple-3-trillion-market-value.html?smid=tw-share" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">first public company</a> in history to hit a $3 trillion market cap. It took 42 years to be worth $1 trillion in 2018, hit $2 trillion two years later, then notched $3 trillion about 17 months after that. Apple’s now worth more than Walmart, Disney, Netflix, Nike, Exxon Mobil, Coca-Cola, Comcast, Morgan Stanley, McDonald’s, AT&T, Goldman Sachs, Boeing, IBM, and Ford combined, per the NYT.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“Take as much time as you need to discuss things. There is no hurry.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A federal judge told jurors to <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/jury-in-elizabeth-holmes-trial-says-it-is-having-trouble-reaching-unanimous-verdict-on-three-of-11-counts-11641237010?mod=hp_lead_pos1" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">keep at it</a> after they said they weren’t able to reach a unanimous verdict on three of the 11 charges against Theranos founder Elizabeth Holmes. They’ve deliberated for more than 46 hours so far without reaching a verdict.<br><br><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>An interview with Ryan Petersen, the CEO of Flexport, that will give you a lot more insight into the supply chain crisis. (<a href="https://noahpinion.substack.com/p/interview-ryan-petersen-ceo-of-flexport?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Noahpinion</a>)</p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/03/the-blackberry-can-no-longer-do-phone-things?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
Good Night, Sweet Prince
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/03/the-blackberry-can-no-longer-do-phone-things?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<img alt="Good Night, Sweet Prince" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/eede302f4e1732f8382b222cef2816cf08211328-1024x669.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Justin Sullivan/Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After a decadelong battle with irrelevance, the BlackBerry is no more. The company <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2022/01/01/tech/blackberry-end-of-life/index.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ended access</a> to basic smartphone functionality for its classic devices today.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What that means: </strong>If you still have a working BlackBerry running on BlackBerry 10 software or 7.1 OS and earlier, it’s time to hang up the phone belt holster for good: As of today, you’ll no longer be able to reliably use that device for SMS, phone calls, data usage, or even calling 911. It’s decor now.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In most cases, newer Android-based BlackBerry phones will continue to function normally. Or, whatever normal means for them.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">End of an era: </strong>Once the crème de la crème of smartphone tech, the BlackBerry had 80 million active users in 2012—with power button-smashers like President Obama, Kim Kardashian, and your uncle who drove an Audi A4.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Still, the company soldiers on. BlackBerry's pivoted to focus on cybersecurity and provide operating systems for cars, as the auto industry moves toward autonomy. Heck, it even moonlit as a meme stock last year.—<em>MK</em></p>
</div>

color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nFor Holmes, the Jig Is Up\n\u003c/font\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/03/elizabeth-holmes-found-guilty-of-fraud-and-conspiracy-in-blockbuster-silicon-valley-trial?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\u0026uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Elizabeth Holmes speaks on stage during the closing session of the Clinton Global Initiative 2015 on September 29, 2015\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/2b8f302ccd5aba2b1ea3e1c6e2c3e2fc95242a02-1024x683.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"source\" style=\"display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eJP Yim/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt took more than 50 hours of deliberations over seven days, but yesterday a jury found Theranos founder Elizabeth Holmes \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/elizabeth-holmes-trial-theranos-ceo-fb79a29d3c426a5cadee7ec5734b6f24?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eguilty\u003c/a\u003e on four charges of criminal fraud. Basically, they concluded that Holmes intentionally lied to investors to raise gobs of money for her company, a blood testing startup that promised to revolutionize health care.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSpoiler alert: It didn’t. And according to the jury, Holmes \u003cem\u003eknew\u003c/em\u003e that it wouldn’t work out even as she touted the company’s tech capabilities to raise nearly $1 billion from the likes of Rupert Murdoch, the DeVos family, and the Waltons of Walmart fame.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe details: \u003c/strong\u003eHolmes was convicted of three counts of wire fraud and one count of conspiracy to commit wire fraud. She was found not guilty on four other charges and the jury couldn’t agree on a verdict for the other three charges. So Holmes went 4/11.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow long will Holmes be behind bars? \u003c/strong\u003eEach of those guilty counts could carry a sentence of 20 years in prison, but legal experts say she’ll probably serve less time than that, given typical sentences in white-collar fraud cases like hers.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eHow we got here\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhen she was 19, Holmes dropped out of Stanford to build a device that could perform hundreds of diagnostic tests more cheaply and more accurately than anything on the market. If the Brew were around back then, she probably would have been a regular—after all, she was labeled the youngest female self-made billionaire by Forbes and drew comparisons to Steve Jobs.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut things unraveled when WSJ investigations in 2015 and 2016 exposed Theranos’s vaunted technology for not actually working. Then came a slew of lawsuits and an indictment, and in 2018 the company dissolved in a thundercloud of disgrace.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eTo many, Holmes’s story reflects the excesses of a venture capital industry that will plug any charismatic founder with a geyser of cash despite their ideas being untested. But Silicon Valley insiders \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2022-01-04/what-investors-learned-from-the-elizabeth-holmes-trial-zero?srnd=premium\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold Bloomberg\u003c/a\u003e that, despite Holmes’s conviction, that faucet won’t be turned off anytime soon. The lure of exponential returns is that powerful.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nBiden Takes on Big Meat to Curb Inflation\n\u003c/font\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/03/biden-goes-after-big-meat-to-combat-inflation?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\u0026uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Beef cow\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/48a42fff26ee041084deab836ec414b2837ebe61-1500x1000.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"source\" style=\"display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYour holiday brisket cost a lot more this year, and President Biden thinks market concentration in the meat industry is a big reason why.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe White House announced yesterday that it’s \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/joe-biden-lifestyle-business-prices-inflation-78335dba9802d7eb727744301d4489df?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esending $1 billion\u003c/a\u003e to independent meat and poultry producers in order to promote competition in the heavily concentrated industry. How concentrated?\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt said that four large meatpacking companies control 85% of the beef market. And this dominance allows these firms to drive up prices more than a market with many different players would allow.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eMeat prices have increased quite a lot over the last year. While the consumer price index across all goods gained 6.8% annually in November, prices for meat rose 16%.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIt’s part of a bigger strategy\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile Biden is currently picking on meat producers, his administration has taken aim at several other industries where, the White House argues, a few big players have exacerbated inflation.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn November, for instance, he asked the FTC to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2021/11/17/biden-ftc-gas-prices/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einvestigate\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e oil and gas companies for ”anti-consumer” behavior that’s driven up gas prices.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe counterargument: \u003c/strong\u003eIndustry groups and some economists say that blaming a lack of competition for recent inflation is like blaming apple juice for your hangover. After the White House alleged that profits for large meatpackers \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/us-policy/2022/01/03/white-house-beef-supply/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erose 300%\u003c/a\u003e during the pandemic, the North American Meat Institute said this analysis “conveniently” omits factors sending prices higher such as worker shortages and supply chain bottlenecks. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eWhether they curb inflation or not, crackdowns on anti-competitive behavior have become a \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/12/25/business/biden-inflation.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecentral feature\u003c/a\u003e of Biden’s economic strategy. Over the summer, even before price growth got out of hand, he issued an executive order with 72 directives to step up antitrust enforcement and promote competition.—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nBack to School Fumbles Its Way Into the New Year\n\u003c/font\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf you thought yesterday was a calm first day back at work, you probably don’t have kids. Public schools in Cleveland, Milwaukee, Atlanta, Newark, and some districts in Michigan have all delayed their starts or switched to remote learning until at least January 10 because of skyrocketing Covid cases among students and staff.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd for schools that stayed open, safety precautions across districts are about as standard as women’s jeans sizing.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eStaff at LA County public and private schools will be required to wear \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.latimes.com/california/story/2022-01-02/l-a-school-staff-to-use-high-grade-masks-amid-omicron-surge?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emedical grade masks\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e indoors and in crowded spaces outdoors.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eOn the other hand, Johnson County—the most populous county in Kansas—is \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.kansascity.com/news/coronavirus/article256941607.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econsidering\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e ending its mask mandate for elementary schools as early as this Thursday.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eLocal leaders who’ve vowed to keep schools open are being met with increased resistance from teachers groups. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn New York City, where Mayor Eric Adams has \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/coronavirus-pandemic-health-lifestyle-nyc-state-wire-new-york-city-27cf48a4e6bf27b65cad886f979c4127?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einsisted\u003c/a\u003e that schools are the safest place for students, representatives of the teachers’ union aren’t so sure that simply sending 1.5 million rapid tests to schools is enough. And in Chicago, teachers have \u003ca href=\"https://blockclubchicago.org/2022/01/03/chicago-teachers-may-refuse-to-work-in-schools-starting-wednesday-amid-covid-19-surge/?utm_source=Pico\u0026utm_campaign=daa130ae48-EMAIL_CAMPAIGN_2021_12_06_01_52_COPY_01\u0026utm_medium=email\u0026utm_term=0_b6b84a5cee-daa130ae48-127052550\u0026mc_cid=daa130ae48\u0026mc_eid=22c845c6a6\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethreatened\u003c/a\u003e to stop working in-person on Wednesday after a botched at-home irrelevance, the BlackBerry is no more. The company \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2022/01/01/tech/blackberry-end-of-life/index.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eended access\u003c/a\u003e to basic smartphone functionality for its classic devices today.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat that means: \u003c/strong\u003eIf you still have a working BlackBerry running on BlackBerry 10 software or 7.1 OS and earlier, it’s time to hang up the phone belt holster for good: As of today, you’ll no longer be able to reliably use that device for SMS, phone calls, data usage, or even calling 911. It’s decor now.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn most cases, newer Android-based BlackBerry phones will continue to function normally. Or, whatever normal means for them.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEnd of an era: \u003c/strong\u003eOnce the crème de la crème of smartphone tech, the BlackBerry had 80 million active users in 2012—with power button-smashers like President Obama, Kim Kardashian, and your uncle who drove an Audi A4.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eStill, the company soldiers on. BlackBerry's pivoted to focus on cybersecurity and provide operating systems for cars, as the auto industry moves toward autonomy.
